verse.name: v1
verse.lines: Dumbarton's drums, they sound so bonnie When they remind me of my Johnny What fond delight can steal upon me when Johnny kneels and kisses me

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: Across the fields of bounding heather Dumbarton tolls the hour of pleasure a song of love that has no measure When Johnny kneels and sings to me

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: Tis he alone that can delight me His graceful eye, it doth invite me And when his tender arms enfold me The blackest night doth turn and dee

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: My love he is a handsome laddie And tho he is Dumbarton's caddie Someday I'll be a captain's lady When Johnny tends his vows to me
